author: cnbc.com
title: Firsthand Technology Value Fund: 1Q Earnings Snapshot
text:
SAN JOSE, Calif. (AP) _ Firsthand Technology Value Fund Inc. (SVVC) on Thursday reported first-quarter net income of $5.6 million, after reporting a loss in the same period a year earlier.
On a per-share basis, the San Jose, California-based company said it had profit of 76 cents. Losses, adjusted for investment gains, came to 37 cents per share.
The technology investment fund posted revenue of $597,500 in the period. Its adjusted revenue was $598,000.
Firsthand Technology Value Fund shares have risen 28 percent since the beginning of the year. The stock has risen 37 percent in the last 12 months.
This story was generated by Automated Insights ( http://automatedinsights.com/ap ) using data from Zacks Investment Research. Access a Zacks stock report on SVVC at https://www.zacks.com/ap/SVVC
